verses.verse: Now these are the nations<WH1471> which the Lord<WH3068> left<WH3240>, to prove<WH5254> Israel<WH3478> by them<WH3045>, even as many of Israel as had not known all the wars<WH4421> of Canaan<WH3667>;

And when the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> cried<WH2199> unto the Lord<WH3068>, the Lord<WH3068> raised up<WH6965> a deliverer<WH3467> to the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, who delivered<WH3467> them<WH6274>, even Othniel the son<WH1121> of Kenaz<WH7073>, Caleb<WH3612>'s younger<WH6996> brother<WH251>.

And the Spirit<WH7307> of the Lord<WH3068> came upon him<WH8199>, and he judged Israel<WH3478>, and went out<WH3318> to war<WH4421>: and the Lord<WH3068> delivered<WH5414> Chushan<WH3573>–rishathaim king<WH4428> of Mesopotamia<WH763> into his hand<WH3027>; and his hand<WH3027> prevailed<WH5810> against Chushan<WH3573>–rishathaim.

And the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> did<WH6213> evil<WH7451> again<WH3254> in the sight<WH5869> of the Lord<WH3068>: and the Lord<WH3068> strengthened<WH2388> Eglon<WH5700> the king<WH4428> of Moab<WH4124> against Israel<WH3478>, because they had done<WH6213> evil<WH7451> in the sight<WH5869> of the Lord<WH3068>.

But when the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> cried<WH2199> unto the Lord<WH3068>, the Lord<WH3068> raised them up<WH6965> a deliverer<WH3467>, Ehud<WH164> the son<WH1121> of Gera<WH1617>, a Benjamite<WH1145>, a man<WH376> lefthanded<WH334>: and by him<WH3027> the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> sent<WH7971> a present<WH4503> unto Eglon<WH5700> the king<WH4428> of Moab<WH4124>.

But Ehud<WH164> made<WH6213> him a dagger<WH2719> which had two<WH8147> edges<WH6366>, of a cubit<WH1574> length<WH753>; and he did wear<WH2296> it under his clothes<WH4055> upon his right<WH3225> thigh<WH3409>.

And Ehud<WH164> put forth<WH7971> his left<WH8040> hand<WH3027>, and took<WH3947> the dagger<WH2719> from his right<WH3225> thigh<WH3409>, and thrust<WH8628> it into his belly<WH990>:

Then Ehud<WH164> went forth<WH3318> through the porch<WH4528>, and shut<WH5462> the doors<WH1817> of the parlour<WH5944> upon him<WH5274>, and locked them.

And it came to pass<WH935>, when he was come, that he blew<WH8628> a trumpet<WH7782> in the mountain<WH2022> of Ephraim<WH669>, and the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> went down<WH3381> with him from the mountain<WH2022>, and he before them<WH6440>.

And they went down<WH3381> after<WH310> him<WH3920>, and took the fords<WH4569> of Jordan<WH3383> toward Moab<WH4124>, and allowed<WH5414> not a man<WH376> to pass over<WH5674>.

And they killed<WH5221> of Moab<WH4124> at that time<WH6256> about ten<WH6235> thousand<WH505> men<WH376>, all lusty<WH8082>, and all men<WH376> of valor<WH2428>; and there escaped<WH4422> not a man<WH376>.
